column4: How does one change the permission on a file that is protected by root? I'm trying to install some software. I converted some rpm files using alien to deb files. Tried to get kpackage to install them but keep on asking for 'root' password. So I opened up kuser and tried to give myself root permission but cannot write to the etc/group files . They must be write permission protected and I'm now sure how to change them.
Is there an easier way to install deb files without using konsole?
in the terminal just type 'dpkg -i filename.db'
